page.title: 14Pidgeon House Farm
page.content: Pidgeon House Farm is a dairy farm and like many other farms in the area,it is a family farm.The farmer has a herd of 130 cows,most of them Fresians with three Guernseys.He starts milking at 6:30am and finishes approximately three hours later.He gets around 4,000 litres of milk from each cow every year.In 1985 the Milk Marketing Board pay 10_15p for a litre of milk during the year.Each cow has a calf annually. He sells the male calves,they fetch about Â£50 each at market.Half the female calves are kept and half go to market,these fetch Â£40 each.A good milking cow could cost Â£700 to buy,but the farmer rears his own replacements. Two_thirds of the cows have calves in Autumn. Milking is done in a parlour and collected in a tank.The local dairy company collect,test and give the farmer a computer number label.
